intro: Trisetopsis leonina, commonly known as the Leonine Trisetopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. Trisetopsis leonina is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
